BASIC_CASE_INFORMATION.case_title: Civil Appeal 232 of 2016 - Nairobi 194677 with metadata
BASIC_CASE_INFORMATION.citation: Kenya Power And Lighting Company Limited v Patrick Njane Mbugua another [2020] eKLR
BASIC_CASE_INFORMATION.subject_matter: Negligence and vicarious liability in a road traffic accident.

COURT_INFORMATION.appellate_court: High Court at Nairobi (Milimani Law Courts)

PARTIES.defendant_respondent: Kenya Power and Lighting Company Limited

LEGAL_ISSUES.key_legal_issues: Ownership of the vehicle and liability for the accident.
LEGAL_ISSUES.grounds_of_appeal: The appellate court found merit in the appellant's arguments regarding vehicle ownership.

OUTCOMES.appellate_outcome: The appellate decision overturned the trial court's finding of liability.

LEGAL_PRINCIPLES.legal_principles_established: Presumption of ownership based on vehicle registration records and vicarious liability.
LEGAL_PRINCIPLES.precedent_value: The case reinforces the application of vicarious liability in road traffic accidents.

PROCEDURAL_ASPECTS.procedural_history: Accident on 25th November 2007; Trial court decision on 27th January 2016; Appeal decision on 04 May 2020.

EVIDENCE_AND_DOCUMENTATION.key_evidence: Documentary evidence in rebutting ownership claims.
